content: The patient is a right-handed male retiree with a history of bilateral carpal tunnel syndrome, right cubital tunnel syndrome, and bilateral thumb CMC arthritis. He presents today for evaluation of worsening bilateral thumb pain since his last visit in 2019, with significant exacerbation over the past six months. He reports no numbness or tingling but experiences substantial pain limiting his thumb function.
title: HPI Spencer

content: Bilateral upper extremity skin is clean, dry and intact. No significant soft tissue swelling, positive grind, positive shoulder sign. No triggering of any digits with the thumb.
title: Musculoskeletal

content: X-rays of the right hand demonstrate moderate joint space neovasculitis with metacarpal osteophytosis. There is evidence of a Z deformity with hyperextension of the MCP joint and calcific arteriogram noted. The left hand shows similar findings except for the calcific arteriogram.
title: Imaging Results

content: Discussed temporary nature of steroids and rebound pain.
Observation for carpal tunnel and cubital tunnel symptoms.
Consider nerve studies for carpal and cubital tunnels.
title: Plan
